page.title: 07PHONES ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S
page.content: Telephones have only been on the islands since 1928.Since then 31 out of 35 homes on St.Martins have been connected.Recently,on the 16th April 1984 a new electronic exchange costing half a million pounds was opened on St.Marys.There are two telephone engineers on the main island of St.Marys,one for the exchange and the other for general work on the off islands. Most boats have ship to shore radios which can be used to call up Falmouth Coastguard in emergencies,but they are more often used to talk to each other.Even by dialling 999 you get Falmouth,as they deal with Scillonian emergency calls. On St.Martins the four man fire crew and the eleven Auxilliary Coastguards,would rely on radio contact in any rescue attempts. Regular practices take place for both.
